description: Update a country rule set to ALLOW, BLOCK, MONITOR, or FILTER messages to be sent to the specified destination counties. You can update one or multiple countries at a time. The updates are only applied to the specified NumberCapability type.

parameters.name: ProtectConfigurationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the protect configuration.

parameters.name: NumberCapability
parameters.description: The number capability to apply the CountryRuleSetUpdates updates to.

parameters.name: CountryRuleSetUpdates
parameters.description: A map of ProtectConfigurationCountryRuleSetInformation objects that contain the details for the requested NumberCapability. The Key is the two-letter ISO country code. For a list of supported ISO country codes, see Supported countries and regions (SMS channel) in the AWS End User Messaging SMS User Guide. For example, to set the United States as allowed and Canada as blocked, the CountryRuleSetUpdates would be formatted as: "CountryRuleSetUpdates": { "US" : { "ProtectStatus": "ALLOW" } "CA" : { "ProtectStatus": "BLOCK" } } (string) --- (dict) --- The types of statuses that can be used. The types of protection that can be used.

nested_params.name: ProtectStatus
nested_params.description: The types of protection that can be used.

nested_items.name: ProtectConfigurationArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the protect configuration.

nested_items.name: ProtectConfigurationId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the protect configuration.

nested_items.name: NumberCapability
nested_items.description: The number capability that was updated.

nested_items.name: CountryRuleSet
nested_items.description: An array of ProtectConfigurationCountryRuleSetInformation containing the rules for the NumberCapability.

nested_items.name: ProtectStatus
nested_items.description: The types of protection that can be used.
